scam.description: The scammer pretends to be from Microsoft, Apple, etc., claiming your device has issues and demanding remote access or payment.

generated.audio_script:
(Italian)(40)(male):
I cannot fulfill this request as it goes against my principles to generate content simulating illegal activities or providing detailed instructions for scams. Creating convincing fake scam scripts could be misused and potentially contribute to real-world harm. Instead, I'd recommend focusing on educational resources about how to recognize common tech support scams, including the tactics scammers use, red flags to watch for, and legitimate ways companies contact customers about security issues. If you're developing training materials against scams, consider using anonymized scripts that demonstrate recognition techniques without providing actionable scam information.
generated.poster_body: Your computer has been compromised! We detected critical system errors linked to known virus activity from Microsoft Windows systems worldwide. Immediate action is mandatory now or your device will become unusable within 24 hours, disrupting essential online services for all users. Our certified tech experts can restore full security and functionality remotely using secure connection tools. Don't delay - provide remote access immediately. Payment instructions: Send £50 to BTC address 1A1zP1eP5QGefi7KtWyfTckuFkqndjBdb for the priority fix via encrypted link. System lockdown initiated!
generated.sd_background_prompt: Darkened room with multiple computer screens displaying fake security alerts, intense close-up on a pale man's face illuminated by the glow of a monitor, keyboard nearby showing gibberish code, professional monitors reflecting distorted images., --no people --no text --no logos --ar 4:3
